messages.title: CUTTING THE COST OF POLITICS
messages.content: If elected, David Cameron's Conservatives would cut the cost of politics in the UK by introducing the following measures: Reduce MP numbers by 10%, Reduce ministerial pay by 5%, Reduce government advisors, Cap civil service bonuses, and Sell government property not needed-saving more than £6.5 million every year and reduce the deficit by £3 billion over the term of a Parliament.

messages.title: SUPPORTING OUR TROOPS
messages.content: Bill Grant has joined Conservative Party Leader David Cameron in calling for more action to support British service men and women. Bill said: 'We must all recognise the dedication and sacrifice our armed forces make...'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Local Conservative candidate Bill Grant has battled alongside the Conservatives against tax rises by both the Liberal Democrats and the Labour Party to increase local taxes.
Pledges support for the military with specific emphasis on improvements to the Operational Allowance and treatment of veterans.

Conservative proposals for tackling immigration include creating a Border Police Force, setting annual limits on non-EU economic migrants, and introducing English language tests for anyone coming to the UK to get married.
A Conservative government would raise the basic state pension for one year for people over 60, funded from money saved by ending the forced retirement age.

issues.economy: Highlights Conservative criticism of Labour's handling of the economy, emphasizing the national debt and advocating for a change.
issues.governance: Proposes cuts to the cost of politics, including reducing the number of MPs and ministerial pay, capping civil service bonuses, and selling unneeded government properties.
issues.immigration: Outlines Conservative immigration policy with proposed measures such as creating a Border Police Force and setting annual limits on non-EU economic migrants.

housing.content: One of the governance measures includes selling unneeded government properties.
